text: Strotmann R (2024). ddir: Assessment clinical DDI risk drug compounds. R package version 0.8.2.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ddir: Assessment of the clinical DDI risk for drug compounds},   author = {Rainer Strotmann},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.8.2}, }

what: Assessment of the clinical DDI risk for drug compounds
title: Assessment of the clinical DDI risk for drug compounds
text: package provides functions analysis clinical drug-drug interaction (DDI) risk per relevant FDA EMA guidelines.

title: Assessment of the clinical DDI risk for drug compounds
text: can install development version ddir using:

title: Assessment of the clinical DDI risk for drug compounds
text: package provides sample data fictional drug, examplinib. following code calculates perpetrator DDI risk direct CYP inhibition (basic method) provides markdown-formatted output table: See also: kinetic_cyp_induction_risk_table(), mech_stat_cyp_risk_table(), basic_ugt_inhibition_risk_table(), transporter_inhibition_risk_table() Full documentation can found github.
code: library(ddir)  p <- examplinib_compounds[[1]] property_table(p) basic_cyp_inhibition_risk_table(p, examplinib_cyp_inhibition_data)

title: Test if Igut of a perpetrator is limited by its solubility — is_igut_solubility_limited
text: solubility field Inf (default), compound solubility larger Igut, function returns FALSE. solubility lower theoretical Igut, .e., lower dose dissolved 250 ml, function returns TRUE. Note solubility expected mg/l.

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: perp perpetrator object. cyp_inh CYP inhibiton data data frame. cyp_ind CYP induction data data frame. include_induction Boolean value define whether induction included calculation (C-terms per FDA guideline) substr CYP reference substrates used data frame.

title: CYP perpetration risk table as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk_table
text: perp perpetrator object. cyp_inh CYP inhibiton data data frame. cyp_ind CYP induction data data frame. include_induction Boolean value define whether induction included calculation (C-terms per FDA guideline) substr CYP reference substrates used data frame. na.rm Remove rows lacking ki data (.e., ki == NA).

what:
#' Read CYP inhibitor data
#'
#' @param source The connection to read from.
#'
#' @return The data as data frame.
#' @export
read_cyp_inhibitor_data <- function(source) 
return(read_dmpk_data(source))

Read csv-formatted CYP inducer data — read_inducer_data
title:
#' Read CYP inhibitor data
#'
#' @param source The connection to read from.
#'
#' @return The data as data frame.

read_cyp_inhibitor_data <- function(source) 
return(read_dmpk_data(source))

what: Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
title: Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
text: input source can either file name string text connection. can used read compound data string.

title: Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
text: file expected comply following: Comments start '#' go end line lines format: drug, parameter, value, source fields within line comma-separated fields plain text without enclosing "" source field reference usually refers clinical non-clinical study report. source field may remain empty. Note line ends comma. metabolites, fields dose, fa, fg ka relevant filled NA. Note multiple compounds, e.g., parent metabolites may included perpetrator file. typical compound file look e.g., like :
code: # name, param, value, source # parent  examplinib,  type,     parent, examplinib,  mw,       492.6, examplinib,  dose,     450,       clinical dose examplinib,  imaxss,   3530,      study 001 examplinib,  fu,       0.023,     study 002 examplinib,  fumic,    1,         default examplinib,  rb,       1,         study 003 examplinib,  fa,       0.81,      study 003 examplinib,  fg,       1,         default examplinib,  ka,       0.00267,   unknown  # metabolite  M1,  type,   metabolite, M1,  mw,     506.56, M1,  dose,   NA, M1,  imaxss, 1038,      study 001 M1,  fu,     0.012,     study 002 M1,  fumic,  1,         default M1,  rb,     1,         study 002 M1,  fa,     NA, M1,  fg,     NA, M1,  ka,     NA,

title: Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
code: read_perpetrators(textConnection(examplinib_compounds_string)) #> $M1 #> == DDI perpetrator object == #> name         M1                        #> type         metabolite                #> mw           506.56                    #> dose         NA                        #> imaxss       1038         study 001    #> fu           0.012        study 002    #> fumic        1            default      #> rb           1            study 002    #> fa           NA                        #> fg           NA                        #> ka           NA                        #> solubility   Inf          default #> $examplinib #> == DDI perpetrator object == #> name         examplinib                    #> type         parent                        #> mw           492.6                         #> dose         450          clinical dose    #> imaxss       3530         study 001        #> fu           0.023        study 002        #> fumic        1            default          #> rb           1            study 003        #> fa           0.81         study 003        #> fg           1            default          #> ka           0.00267      unknown          #> solubility   Inf          default
